speaker: SCULLY
line: Relax, they’ll be here.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Bank’s going to close in five minutes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sure it wasn’t a bogus tip?

speaker: WILLIS
line: No. It’s real. I’ve been on this long enough. I know the difference. Besides, I can feel it. I can feel them. I’m inside their heads.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just as long as you keep yours.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Message received, Agent Scully, loud and clear. Position five. It’s Agent Willis. Do you copy?

speaker: (SAME TIME
line: Outside the bank in a car, DUPRE and LULA, hard and rough looking, 30’s. LULA is in driver’s seat. DUPRE loads gun. LULA watches the bank.)

speaker: DUPRE
line: What, are you nervous?

speaker: LULA
line: Nope. I just don’t want our luck to run out.

speaker: DUPRE
line: Baby, you are my luck. No matter what happens, whenever I look up at the stars I know you’re going to be looking up at the same ones.

speaker: LULA
line: The same ones, baby.

speaker: DUPRE
line: You make every day like New Year’s Eve.

speaker: DUPRE
line: Get down! Get down on the ground! I want everyone on the ground now! NOW! Get down! You too --- on the floor! On the floor! I’ll execute every one of you!

speaker: DUPRE
line: Put the money in the bag now! Move! Shut up and do it!

speaker: WILLIS
line: Dupre! Drop the gun! FBI! Drop the gun, NOW!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I need more saline in here, stat.

speaker: NURSE
line: Up to 360, now.

speaker: INTERN
line: 11 minutes, 55 seconds. Clear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Jack.

speaker: INTERN
line: He’s been flatlined for over twelve minutes.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Another amp of EPI and we’ll go again at 360. Clear.

speaker: NURSE
line: Still no pulse.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We’ve done all we can. I’m sorry.

speaker: INTERN
line: You want me to pronounce?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. You can’t give up on him.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: It’s been over 13 minutes. He’s dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go up to 400.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We lost him. Let him go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m a doctor. Go up to 400, or I’ll do it myself.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Clear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give him another amp of EPI intracardial and go up to 400 again. Do it.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Clear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Again. Come on, Jack.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Clear.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We got a rhythm. Don’t ask me how, but he’s back. BP’s 80 over 50 and climbing. 90 over 50 …

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any word from Willis?

speaker: MULDER
line: Still missing. He hasn't been home or checked in with the office. I heard something on the way down about a mutilation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Three fingers on Dupre's left hand were severed by surgical shears. We lifted prints. They're Willis’.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said he was chasing this guy for almost a year?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, he lived the case. It was all he thought about, talked about.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you thinking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That maybe this is some kind of post-trauma psychosis. Like the way soldiers sometimes mutilate the body of a dead enemy.

speaker: MULDER
line: That still doesn't explain why he would just vanish. Dupre's partner-- who was she? Lula Phillips.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They met while she was serving a ten year sentence for manslaughter at the Women's Correctional Facility of Maryland.

speaker: MULDER
line: He was a prison guard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Until the warden found out about their secret. According to Lula's cell mate they carried on quite a torrid romance.

speaker: MULDER
line: It says here she was released on May 2, 1993.

speaker: SCULLY
line: One week before the first robbery at Annapolis Savings and Loan. The 65-year-old female teller was pistol-whipped. Died from a massive subdural hemorrhage all because she didn’t put the money in the bag fast enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lovely couple.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, apparently they took turns --- one pulling a job while the other one drove getaway. Between the two of them, they’ve killed seven people and gotten away with close to $100,000.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s a lot of money now that she doesn’t have to split it two ways.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we’re putting her face out there --- local newspapers, America’s Most Wanted. Am I boring you?

speaker: MULDER
line: They were married.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Last May in Atlantic City. So what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think this was a simple necrophiliac mutilation. Willis sliced and diced those fingers to get at the wedding ring.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Anybody here? Lula? Baby, baby. baby. Damn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a left thumbprint.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can see by these two bifurcations here that whoever held that cleaver was using his left hand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean, "whoever"? It was Willis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Willis is right-handed. I checked his pistol grip at the armory. But all the bank surveillance tapes show that Dupre is left-handed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not sure where you're going.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long did Willis flatline before you revived him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just over 13 minutes.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the EKG strip that recorded his cardiac activity at the time. Now, *in your medical opinion,* what does that look like?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It could be anything – an instrument malfunction, electrical overload.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what does it *look* like?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two heartbeats.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, you say Dupre and Willis went into cardiac arrest at the exact same time, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which means for minutes, both men were technically dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Technically, but we resuscitated Willis.

speaker: MULDER
line: You resuscitated his body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Two men died in that crash room, Scully. One man came back. The question is … which one?

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: What can you tell me about near-death experiences, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The usual stuff – the tunnel, the light, people rising up and viewing their own bodies.

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: And as a scientist, how do you account for the phenomenon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Some sort of disassociative, hallucinatory activity.

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: Did you know that half of all adults who have had a near-death experience can not wear a watch? The increased electrical activity in their bodies renders the watches on their wrists inoperable. Now, I know this sounds kooky, but as any biologist will tell you, when cells die and genetic material begins to unfold, a tremendous charge of energy is released.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Varnes believes this burst of energy is responsible for the transformational nature of the experience.

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: People do return from the event profoundly changed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Changed how?

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: Personality shifts, perceived psychic abilities, increased zest for life.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the negative consequences?

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: Well, they’re rare, but apparently, in the process of dying there is a window of time during which the body is vulnerable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t understand.

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: Well, there was a pilot in my support group who died in a commuter plane crash along with his three passengers. This was a few years ago. He recalls floating up in a brilliant aura of light and then feeling an overwhelming need to return to his body. He was revived in the ambulance on the way to the hospital --- the only survivor. It was soon after that that the visions started. Visions of making love to his wife but in ways and places that weren’t in his memory. Now, it turns out that one of the dead passengers on the plane was having an affair with his wife. The dead passenger’s memory, his consciousness had survived through the pilot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: PROF. VARNES
line: Well, the pilot became increasingly disoriented – a schizophrenic, his doctor claims – until one day he strangled his wife with an extension cord.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s a nice story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: nan

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t discount the near-death experience because it can be explained empirically by stimulation of the temporal lobe.

speaker: MULDER
line: I sense a big "but" coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s my still best guess Jack’s disappearance can be explained in psychological, not supernatural, terms.

speaker: MULDER
line: For instance?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The stress of the case, the trauma of being shot….. Jack’s personality.

speaker: MULDER
line: How well do you know him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We dated … for almost a year. He was my instructor at the academy.

speaker: MULDER
line: The plot thickens.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We even had the same birthday. We used to celebrate in some dive in Statford that had a slanting pool table. But it was always so hard for Jack to relax. It was impossible for him really. He was always so intense, so relentlessly determined.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you believe he’s predisposed to this type of psychotic episode?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe it’s a long way from saying Jack had a near-death experience to saying his body’s been inhabited by Warren Dupre. A long way.

speaker: TOMMY
line: What the hell?

speaker: WILLIS
line: You’re such a creature of habit, Tommy.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Who the hell are you?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Get out of bed.

speaker: TOMMY
line: I ain’t got no clothes on.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Get out of bed. I don’t want to shoot you lying down.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Who are you, the rent man? ‘Cause I’m all paid up. I swear, I’m not kidding you. Come on, you can go ask Cosmo.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Shut up. Where is she?

speaker: TOMMY
line: Where’s who?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Your sister.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Lula? I don’t know. I was waiting to see her on the news. What I tell you? Check it out.

speaker: TOMMY
line: The sound’s busted. Looks like they’ll find her before you do, pal.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Is that what you think? That’s not what I think. I miss her, Tommy. I miss her so bad. That’s why I came back.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Do I know you from somewhere?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Everything I see, I see her.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Jesus, man, you’re bleeding.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Even ugliness is beautiful because of her.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Okay, what are you doing?

speaker: WILLIS
line: You set us up, Tommy. You sold us out to the FBI.

speaker: TOMMY
line: Dupre?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Neighbors heard a gunshot, but nobody bothered to check it out. The patrol guys responded this morning to an anonymous 911 and found him here, except the rats found him first. The victim’s name was Thomas Phillips.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That’s Lula’s brother.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Well, there’s not a lot of family resemblance left between the rats and the .45 he took in the face. Oh, I hate this nicotine stuff.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s his story?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: He’s single. He’s lived here alone for the past seven months. A few priors, small stuff, mostly – B and E, narcotics possession. Nothing like his big sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was the television turned on when they found him?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: No. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think Tommy was much a reader since he doesn’t seem to have owned any books and from the position of the body, I’d say maybe he was watching the tube when he was shot.

speaker: OFFICER DANIELS
line: Print kit’s right over there. Knock yourself out.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Out of my way, Ace.

speaker: OFFICER DANIELS
line: Regulations state to gain access to a crime scene, you got to show me some ID.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like you were right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Jack…

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there a problem here?

speaker: WILLIS
line: No, I just don’t have any ID. And would you tell this gentleman who I am?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s all right, Officer. This is Agent Jack Willis. He’s with the Violent Crimes Section of the Washington Bureau. Come on. Let’s talk out here.

speaker: OFFICER DANIELS
line: I was just doing my job.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For God’s sake, Willis, what happened? Half the Bureau’s been looking for you. Where have you been?

speaker: WILLIS
line: I don’t know. I just … wasn’t myself. I just kinda woke up out in the street.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m taking you back to the hospital. You’re in no shape to be ---

speaker: WILLIS
line: No, no, no way! I’m staying right here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re not ready to be here.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Who says?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack. You’re recovering from a major trauma. It’s a miracle you’re even able to walk around.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Look. This is Tommy Phillip’s place, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack …

speaker: WILLIS
line: Let me just ask you something. Was he killed with a .45?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As a matter of fact he was.

speaker: WILLIS
line: He was. That’s Lula’s weapon of choice. I know these people. I’ve been after them for a long time. We’re halfway there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You did open the book on this one.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah. And I’m gonna be there when it’s closed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right. But as a colleague and as a friend I’m recommending you undergo a full medical evaluation --- physical and psychological.

speaker: WILLIS
line: All right, fair enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jack, good to see you back among the living.

speaker: WILLIS
line: It’s good to be back.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Jack.

speaker: WILLIS
line: So what do we got here?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Mulder here found a print on the TV – a partial oblique – and it’s not the victim’s.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Good work, Agent Mulder. I’m impressed.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s fancy shooting.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah, well, I got to get recertified before they give me my weapon back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, by the looks of it, I wouldn’t worry about recertification.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Is there anything else you wanted?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. It’s, uh, Scully’s birthday and I was wondering if you’d sign that for her.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Sure. Be glad to. I’m always glad to celebrate the good times.

speaker: WILLIS
line: There you go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Happy Birthday, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re two months early.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s from Willis. I thought you two had the same birthday.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that’s news to him. I asked him to sign it. And he signed it with his left hand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean you tested him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. After I found out that the evidence from the Phillips murder is missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What evidence?

speaker: MULDER
line: The print we lifted. Our best lead is gone. Someone stole it before the lab had a chance to take a look at it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you think Willis is responsible?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not sure Willis is Willis. Can you at least accept the possibility that during his near-death experience some kind of psychic transference occurred?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can’t you accept the possibility that this isn’t an X-File? Aside from the expected level of post-trauma stress, Jack passed both of his evaluations --- physical and psychological. Anyway, just because someone forgets a birthday doesn’t mean that he’s been possessed. When I was studying for my medical boards, I forgot my birthday too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you forget how to sign your name? This is a copy of the automobile requisition form Willis filed the day before he was shot. Compare the signatures.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like I said, Mulder, stress, all right? We both know it can significantly affect someone’s cursive standard. I’m afraid this doesn’t prove a thing.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Agent Willis here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack. Where are you going?

speaker: WILLIS
line: We got a break. A landlord in Boyle Heights thinks he’s got our girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hotline?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah. Saw her picture in the post office. Here’s the address.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack, can I ask you something?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah, sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Phillips murder. The print Mulder lifted off the television --- it’s missing.

speaker: WILLIS
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And … you were carrying the evidence back.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Are you implying something, Agent Scully? I don’t know anything about any missing print. Now, I’m ten minutes from closing the biggest case in my career. Are you coming?

speaker: WILLIS
line: What’s that apartment number again?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Number 202.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Oh, yeah. What’s this guy’s name?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Multrevich.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Multrevich?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Mr. Multrevich? I’m from the FBI. Jack Willis. We spoke on the phone.

speaker: MULTREVICH
line: Oh, yeah.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Have you ever seen this lady?

speaker: MULTREVICH
line: Yeah. 207. Two days ago. First and last month, cash.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’s 207?

speaker: MULTREVICH
line: Down the hallway, around the corner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, Mr. Multrevich, we want you to go back inside your apartment and stay away from the windows.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’s our back up? You said you called them, right?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah, they should have been here ten minutes ago. She may be running down a fire escape, or something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m going to call in again.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Look. Hey, that’s her.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Where is she? Where did she go?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ll check back here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Face down! Face down! Hands behind your back. Now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s all yours, Jack.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah, like a dog on a leash.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I already cuffed her.

speaker: WILLIS
line: They’re for you, Scully. Put them on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s going on, Jack?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Put them on, or I’ll blow you in half.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack …

speaker: WILLIS
line: Shut up! Put them on.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Come on, baby. Come on, get up, baby. I want to look at you. Your face is all dirty.

speaker: LULA
line: Keep your stinking hands off me.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Baby, you ain’t going to believe where I been.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Sure it’s crazy. You don’t think I know it’s crazy? This isn’t my face, these aren’t my hands, but it’s me in here. And I know you, I know everything about you, baby. Come on, ask me something. Your birthday’s April 7th. Your favorite color is red. Come on. Come on, ask me something else. Come on, ask me.

speaker: LULA
line: Okay. Okay, what did we do after we got married?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Right after?

speaker: LULA
line: After that.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Well, we went down to the beach. I took out my buck knife and I sliced open my palm and then I slit open your palm … and we let the blood drip down in the water.

speaker: LULA
line: Then what did you say to me?

speaker: WILLIS
line: I said, "This is so we can be married in all the oceans of the world." And then I made you a solemn oath … to never take this ring off my finger. Ever. I mean to keep that promise.

speaker: LULA
line: This is … this is just too weird. I can’t believe it’s really you.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Don’t worry, baby. It won’t make any difference in the dark.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Thank you sir, we’ll be in touch.

speaker: MULTREVICH
line: When do I get my reward?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: We’ll call you.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Now *I’m* worried. 12 hours with no word. I don’t get it. Why’s their car still sitting out front? Why didn’t Willis call for backup?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because it wasn’t Willis who answered the hot line.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: What are you talking about? You heard the recording. It was Willis’ voice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Forget it, Bruskin.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Plus which, the manager just ID’d him and Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: I said forget it, Bruskin.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: This isn’t one of your X-File theories, is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn’t matter what I think. We’re still after the same thing. Mulder.

speaker: VOICE
line: FBI Centrex Operator. Please hold.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Guess who, Ace?

speaker: MULDER
line: Willis?

speaker: WILLIS
line: That depends on who you ask, don’t it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Scully?

speaker: WILLIS
line: You’re the FBI. You figure it out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me talk to her.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Yeah. Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana, are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don’t ---

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Okay. That’s it. Good-bye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not going to work, Jack.

speaker: WILLIS
line: You don’t think so?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bureau policy prohibits negotiating with kidnappers. But you already know that, don’t you, Jack?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Stop calling me that!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your name is Jack Willis. You were born February 23, 1957. You live at 51 Stanhope ---

speaker: WILLIS
line: My name is Warren James Dupre. And I was born in Klamath Falls, Oregon in the Year of the Rat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We spent a weekend up at Pine Barrens. You taught me how to fish through the ice. It was your parents’ cabin. Jack, try to remember. We drove up in a snowstorm. Come on, Jack.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Don’t think I didn’t see what you did. I was like a little slip of paper up there on that hospital ceiling. I saw everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you see?

speaker: WILLIS
line: You left me to die on that table while you tried to save your friend!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You *are* my friend.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Too bad he was gone already. I watched him go. I just saw him slip away down that long, black tunnel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. We brought you back.

speaker: WILLIS
line: You shot me dead! And then you let me die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. You won’t kill me, Jack.

speaker: WILLIS
line: You call me that one more time I’ll make you stone-cold.

speaker: LULA
line: Easy, baby, easy. Not yet. Remember, she’s our ticket.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Got any more of this soda?

speaker: LULA
line: You just drank the last of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Soda. How much of that have you had?

speaker: WILLIS
line: What’s it to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack Willis is diabetic. Which means you’re diabetic. Too much sugar in the system could lead to hyperglycemia.

speaker: LULA
line: Maybe that’s why your stomach’s hurting so bad.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Abdominal pain is the first sign of impending diabetic coma. You need insulin.

speaker: WILLIS
line: I feel myself getting into their heads and I'm scared by what I'm feeling. The intoxicating freedom that comes from disconnecting action and consequence. Theirs is a world where nothing matters but their own needs, their own impossible appetites and while the pleasure they derive from acts of violence is clearly sexual, it also speaks to what Warden Jackson called their operatic devotion to each other. It's a love affair I almost envy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Katensville PD just reported a drugstore was broken into right here on the corner of Old Forge Road and Madison and I’m betting that Scully is somewhere within this five mile radius.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Am I missing something?

speaker: MULDER
line: 200 units of NPH insulin were taken with a box of syringes. Willis is diabetic.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Get me a census report. Let’s see how many households we’re talking about.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Quick,. quick, quick. My legs are starting to go numb.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold on.

speaker: WILLIS
line: What the hell …?

speaker: LULA
line: Drop the needle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Without this medicine, he dies.

speaker: LULA
line: Yes, so you said. Now, put it down … unless you want me to put you down with it.

speaker: WILLIS
line: What the hell are you doing, Lula? I need that medicine.

speaker: LULA
line: You still haven’t figured it out, have you?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Figured what out?

speaker: LULA
line: It wasn’t my brother who set you up.

speaker: WILLIS
line: You?

speaker: LULA
line: Yeah, me. How do you think I got away so clean, huh? The minute you stepped into that bank I was out of there. I got the money, and I got rid of you. At least I thought I did.

speaker: PHONE AGENT
line: Tactical. This is it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: LULA
line: Listen carefully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Willis?

speaker: LULA
line: Oh, he's lying around here somewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me talk to Scully.

speaker: LULA
line: Not this time.

speaker: MULDER
line: We don’t deal unless we know Scully is alive.

speaker: LULA
line: She’s alive. She’s not happy, but she’s alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: You listen to me --- you lay one hand on Scully, and so help me, God ----

speaker: LULA
line: If I were you, I’d stop talking and start passing around the collection hat ‘cause if you ever want to see Scully again it’s going to cost you a million dollars. Have it by this time tomorrow. I'll tell you when and where.

speaker: PHONE AGENT
line: We got it. It’s a 202 number.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Great. Get the address.

speaker: MULDER
line: Forget it. It’s Scully’s cellular number. They’re using her phone. We can’t trace them.

speaker: LULA
line: She’s not happy, but she’s alive. If I were you, I'd stop talking and start passing around the collection hat.

speaker: TECH
line: That last part, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but can you squelch the voice even more this time?

speaker: TECH
line: Yep. Done.

speaker: LULA
line: If I were you, I'd stop talking and start passing around the collection hat.

speaker: TECH
line: Yep. Yeah. There’s something there. Definitely something at the high end. Let me throw on an extra Z -14 filter and isolate everything over half a decibel.

speaker: LULA
line: If I were you, I'd stop talking and start passing around the collection hat.

speaker: MULDER
line: There. That engine sound.

speaker: TECH
line: Let’s clean it up some more.

speaker: LULA
line: If I were you, I'd stop talking and start passing around the collection hat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that a small plane?

speaker: TECH
line: Taking off, by the sound of it. Give me a couple more minutes. We’ll guesstimate the altitude within a couple hundred feet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Great!

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: All right, people, settle down and grab a seat. Mulder says he’s got something.

speaker: AGENT WESTIN
line: What? An alien virus or new information on the Kennedy assassination?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Hey, Mulder’s all right. You should pay attention. You might learn something from the man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, from our last phone contact we’ve identified what sounds like light aircraft taking off. Now, Washington County Regional Airport happens to fall within our area, just south of the state line. Since takeoffs are north to south it’s a fair bet that our target area lies along this flight path. For those of you who remember ninth-grade math that gives us an area of just over three square miles to cover --- roughly 1000 households. With 100 law enforcement officials at our disposal at about 30 households per man per hour we should be able to canvass the entire area in about three hours. Agent Bruskin will grid the target area and divide it among the teams.

speaker: MULDER
line: And for those of you ---who don’t know already this one’s important to me. So, uh, let’s do it right. Thanks.

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Let me see Steinburg, Calder, and Westin.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmn? Huh?

speaker: WILLIS
line: Was there snow?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, Jack. There was lots of snow.

speaker: WILLIS
line: I can’t …

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was December. It was the weekend after Thanksgiving.

speaker: WILLIS
line: I remember ---- a red stove.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. That’s right. There was a wood-burning stove right in the middle of the room.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Cold.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: WILLIS
line: So cold. I remember I had to wrap you in a blanket when the wood ran out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! Jack, don’t close your eyes. Come on, keep talking. Jack, keep talking. Come on.

speaker: DUPRE
line: Get down on the floor! Get over there!

speaker: WILLIS
line: I’m gonna execute every one of you!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No.

speaker: DUPRE
line: Shut up and do it!

speaker: LULA
line: Just a second. Who is it?

speaker: BIBLE SALESMAN
line: This is Brother T. Could I speak with you for just one moment, please?

speaker: LULA
line: What do you want?

speaker: BIBLE SALESMAN
line: Just a few minutes of your time, ma’am. Beautiful day, isn’t it? I wonder if I can interest you in the Word of the Lord --- leather bound in black or red your choice.

speaker: LULA
line: Go away.

speaker: BIBLE COP
line: This is one-four. Target sighted.

speaker: LULA
line: Well, I guess it’s time to make that call.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s dead. It’s all on you now. He’s dead because of you.

speaker: LULA
line: Well … guess it’s over. Whoever you are.

speaker: WILLIS
line: Don’t move.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack!

speaker: WILLIS
line: Shut up!

speaker: LULA
line: I love you. Don’t you know? You’re why I came back.

speaker: AGENT WESTIN
line: This is Westin. They battened down the hatches. There’s no clear shot from this side. What about you guys?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ditto. Hold your positions. Keep radios at two.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do we look?

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: Backup’s in but we still don’t know what’s going on in there.

speaker: MULDER
line: We will soon enough.

speaker: LULA
line: I kept a bottle of medicine in the other room. I’ll go get it. What do you say, huh? I’ll get it for you. Look, look, look. I love you. I love you, baby.

speaker: WILLIS
line: No.

speaker: LULA
line: Listen, listen, listen. We still have her. We can get away with this.

speaker: WILLIS
line: I don’t think so, baby. Not this time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack, put the gun down.

speaker: WILLIS
line: You remember that --- light that I talked about? It’s beautiful. There’s nothing to be afraid of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No!

speaker: AGENT BRUSKIN
line: All right, FBI! FBI!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, are you okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jack!?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi. I got this from the morgue along with the rest of his personal effects. I thought you might want it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Happy 35th, Love D." I got it for him three years ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Next of kin?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh .. no. Jack was an only child. Both his parents died when he was in college. There’s a kid over in Parklawn. Jack’s been his Big Brother so I’m going to go and see him tomorrow. What am I going to tell him?

speaker: MULDER
line: The official story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Fugitive Lula Phillips died yesterday in a shoot-out with federal agents which also resulted in the death of Special Agent Jack Willis – killed in the line of duty.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I supposed to tell myself?

speaker: MULDER
line: Good night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not working. It stopped. At 6:47.

speaker: MULDER
line: The exact time that Jack went into cardiac arrest at the hospital.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does that mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: It means … It means whatever you want it to mean. Good night.
